FUSION Act
IN THE UNITED STATES SENATE August 14th, 2024 Mr. Twos (for himself,) introduced the following bill; A BILL To encourage and incentivise nuclear fusion research in America, and to explore how nuclear fusion energy can be regulated. Be it enacted by the Senate and the House of Represen...
ID: 1274036495052963931
Nord íâ£íåííãºíàæíäëíåì
04:06 PM
The following has been referred and is up for debate.
ID: 1274036528699674645
derek | „Éá„É¨„ÉÉ„ÇØ FREE ALDERAAN
04:12 PM
I'd like to briefly speak on this bill and its goal.

It establishes a nuclear fusion innovation fund with investment over the next 4 years, as well as commissioning the nuclear regulatory commission to review regulations pertaining to nuclear fusion, as well as providing recommendations to both Congress and the President on what can be done in order to advance the field of nuclear fusion. While we are part of ITER, we must continue to focus on domestic nuclear fusion research as well as investing in global nuclear fusion research for the betterment of society. If there are any major issues on this bill I'm glad to address them.

I would also like to make the enquiry whether there are existing regulations or guidelines for the provision of grants that this would follow, given the lack of specificity of the bill. (e.g. to ensure that all $90 million isn't all given to a single firm, or doesn't establish an unfair program that gives more to those who are wealthy)
ID: 1288621090154872947

05:45 PM
Interesting, I did not consider those perspectives. I think I can offer an amendment to quell some of those concerns later today

H.R. 2 | SALINGER Act of 2024
H.R. 2 IN THE CONGRESS OF THE UNITED STATES OCTOBER 20, 2024 Mr. SALINGER (for himself) introduced the following bill; A BILL To reform mental health care, expand substance use treatment programs, and promote the well-being of individuals and communities across the United States. Be it ...
ID: 1299150952850522112
Z-„Ç∏„Éû„Éû„É≥
12:59 AM
Mr Chairman, I strongly support this bill‚Äôs initiative in safeguarding the mental wellbeing of our people, especially the rural folk which frequently get left out on these programs.


I come from Frontier, where substantial percentages of gun related deaths are from rural suicides. These are best resolved with the mental health care outlined in this bill, and I believe would serve as a healing platform towards many other social issues.

Mental health care has always been an overlooked part of healthcare, and I am determined not to keep it out of the light any longer.

I implore my colleagues who are better versed in finances to review the appropriation technicalities, but I support the motive and the general actions this bill proposes.

Infant Abortion Survivors Protection Act
H. R. 14 IN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES November 24, 2024 Ms. KINSEY, for herself introduced the following bill A BILL To require health care practitioners to provide appropriate care to a child who survives an abortion or an attempted abortion. Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Repr...
ID: 1317873534625775697
Seaver
05:20 PM (edited)
I want to share my thoughts regarding the bills within this committee:

H.R.24 - This bill was one I supported while in the House. It is a great bill in the fact that it makes people think about how much caffeine they are consuming. We are not banning or changing anything, all we would be doing is alerting people and trying to show them signs when using caffeine. It would help people make more conscious choices about how and what caffeine they consume.

S.1 - This bill provides reform and deregulation for our maritime industry. There have been many issues such as strikes and unions that have caused multiple issues within the industry. Automation is a great idea in order to help cut back on useless jobs and money. This bill will also take away some power from the unions and give rights back to each individual worker.

ID: 1337867581419425872

ID: 1337935941121081406
Kaylalicious
12:09 AM (edited)
@Seaver
https://docs.google.com/document/d/11mptpm1QZ8tlmrfPWOUjSOP3Iz3Odj3vKEL99tsppKE/edit?tab=t.0
I move to amend the following:
> SEC. 8. ACCOUNTABILITY.
> (a) Reports of produced weapons shall be delivered to Congress every ~~1 year.~~ 4 months.
I spoke with the bill‚Äôs author, and after proposing the idea of four months instead of a year myself, he told me that his original bill included four months but was, for whatever reason, amended to a year.

I, along with the author of this bill, believe that yearly reporting is simply too little, and should definitely happen more frequently (three times a year).
ID: 1337938326912766044

It is strictly against the rules to edit a document after it's been docketed, and can get negmods and meta consequences.

02:51 AM
I move to amend S.3 by adding:

`Section 8. Certificate of compliance program
1. The FTC shall create a Certification of Compliance Program for companies that wish to demonstrate their adherence to fair warranty practices in compliance with the standards of this Act. Companies that obtain certification will receive a 'seal of approval' to use in their marketing materials.
`
`Section 6. Enforcement and Penalties
5. The FTC shall have an additional $5,000,000 for the certificate of compliance program.
`

09:48 PM
// excuse me if these sound ranty or unstructured because I‚Äôm voice typing these
ID: 1364719697815142423
Vote Francis - McCarthy!
09:50 PM (edited)
First I rise in support of my resolution for a constitutional amendment that allows Congress to regulate artificial intelligence. Currently we stand in a relative lawless state when it comes to regulations in protections when it comes to the American people on the topic of artificial intelligence. There is no constitutional mandate that would allow the government to explicitly dictate Anything when it comes to artificial intelligence, but because it‚Äôs something that is predicted to be so impactful for society, I believe it is our duty as Stewart‚Äôs of Congress, the United States government, and the American people in general that we should pass an amendment that will allow us to steer the future of artificial intelligence in the correct way.
ID: 1364720103350079619
Vote Francis - McCarthy!
09:54 PM
Next, I would like to express my support for, what is again, my own bill. The pump and dump prevention act is in amendment to the American legal code that would explicitly state that cryptocurrencies, and what should be illegal manipulation thereof, our prosecutable offenses. We have all seen our fair share of pump and dump schemes with cryptocurrencies. From meme coins to NFT‚Äôs the judicial system has been largely unable to prosecute these because cryptocurrencies and other digital assets are not explicitly stated as something within their jurisdiction. Therefore, I find it necessary to amend our legal codes And prevent these fraudulent scams that have gone unnoticed for too long. In conclusion, the two bills that I have presented to this committee today are necessary reforms that allow Congress to protect, defend, and preserve Americans, society, well-being, prosperity. I urge my fellow committee members to join me in support of a favorable recommendation to the side floor for these two bills. Thank you.
ID: 1364721214236528741
Vote Francis - McCarthy!
09:56 PM (edited)
with that being said I seek unanimous consent to favorably recommend joint resolution four and Senate bill five to the floor.

Mr. Chair, seeing as though the federal age to purchase alcohol and tobacco are 21, I believe that that age should also be mirrored for marijuana. I seek UC to strike "eighteen" each place it appears (the "to" section, section 4(a), and section 4(b)), and insert "twenty-one" in its place for HR 25.
ID: 1366549237231521822
Kaylalicious
11:01 PM
@Neel McGavin
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KrFmVPpuAi-WlV67bBfQpNSJyO_6Mq5zQuPRVvS7ty0/edit?usp=drivesdk
Mr. Chair, i further seek UC to pass the following amendments to hr 13, and if objected to, ask that they are put to a vote en bloc:

1. In section IV, subsection II, strike "100,000,000,000$," and insert in its place "up to $75,000,000,000"
2. In section IV, subsection II, insert after the sentence the following: "No more than 5% of any STAR funds allocated to a school district may be used for administrative salaries or non-personnel expenses."
3. In section IV, after subsection VII, insert the following: "VIII. Schools receiving STAR funds must demonstrate at least a 4% improvement in test scored & graduation rates, or a 4% reduction in reported campus crime rates within two academic years to remain eligible for future STAR funding."

Vice-President Noah (L-AR-JK)
02:29 AM
I am opposed to this because the bill is extremely broad and far exceeds the power or scope of the federal government.
> All ISPs shall offer a basic, no-cost internet plan to each household that provides:
> - A base speed of 50 Mbps, plus
> - Technology startups that are developing scalable carbon-negative systems.
Does anyone even know what the second part means? The Senate should not have to waste its time on nonsense. Even if the ideals are good, this bill is irredeemable and must be started anew, which is not necessarily the job of a committee.
